org.microbean.kubernetes.controller

Class EventDistributor<T extends HasMetadata>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T>
      • org.microbean.kubernetes.controller.EventDistributor<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - a type of Kubernetes resource
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Consumer<EventQueue<? extends T>>

    @Immutable
 @ThreadSafe
public final class EventDistributor<T extends HasMetadata>
extends ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T>
implements AutoCloseable
    A ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer that consumes EventQueue instances by feeding each AbstractEvent in the EventQueue being consumed to Consumers of AbstractEvents that have been registered.

    EventDistributor instances must be closed and discarded after use.

    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    addConsumer(Consumer), removeConsumer(Consumer), ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(AbstractEvent)

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventDistributor

        public EventDistributor(Map<Object,T> knownObjects)
        Creates a new EventDistributor.
        Parameters:
        knownObjects - a mutable Map of Kubernetes resources that contains or will contain Kubernetes resources known to this EventDistributor and whatever mechanism (such as a Controller) is feeding it; may be null
        See Also:
        EventDistributor(Map, Duration)

      • EventDistributor

        public EventDistributor(Map<Object,T> knownObjects,
                        Duration synchronizationInterval)
        Creates a new EventDistributor.
        Parameters:
        knownObjects - a mutable Map of Kubernetes resources that contains or will contain Kubernetes resources known to this EventDistributor and whatever mechanism (such as a Controller) is feeding it; may be null
        synchronizationInterval - a Duration representing the interval after which an attempt to synchronize might happen; may be null in which case no synchronization will occur
        See Also:
        ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer(Map)

    • Method Detail

      • addConsumer

        public final void addConsumer(Consumer<? super AbstractEvent<? extends T>> consumer)
        Adds the supplied Consumer to this EventDistributor as a listener that will be notified of each AbstractEvent this EventDistributor receives.

        The supplied Consumer's Consumer.accept(Object) method may be called later on a separate thread of execution.

        Parameters:
        consumer - a Consumer of AbstractEvents; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        See Also:
        addConsumer(Consumer, Function), removeConsumer(Consumer)

      • addConsumer

        public final void addConsumer(Consumer<? super AbstractEvent<? extends T>> consumer,
                              Function<? super Throwable,Boolean> errorHandler)
        Adds the supplied Consumer to this EventDistributor as a listener that will be notified of each AbstractEvent this EventDistributor receives.

        The supplied Consumer's Consumer.accept(Object) method may be called later on a separate thread of execution.

        Parameters:
        consumer - a Consumer of AbstractEvents; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        errorHandler - a Function to handle any Throwables encountered; may be null in which case a default error handler will be used instead
        See Also:
        removeConsumer(Consumer)

      • removeConsumer

        public final void removeConsumer(Consumer<? super AbstractEvent<? extends T>> consumer)
        Removes any Consumer equal to a Consumer previously added to this EventDistributor.
        Parameters:
        consumer - the Consumer to remove; may be null in which case no action will be taken
        See Also:
        addConsumer(Consumer)

      • close

        public final void close()
        Releases resources held by this EventDistributor during its execution.
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable

      • shouldSynchronize

        public final boolean shouldSynchronize()
        Returns true if this EventDistributor should synchronize with its upstream source.

        Design Notes

        The Kubernetes tools/cache package spreads synchronization out among the reflector, controller, event cache and event processor constructs for no seemingly good reason. They should probably be consolidated, particularly in an object-oriented environment such as Java.

        Returns:
        true if synchronization should occur; false otherwise
        See Also:
        EventCache.synchronize()

      • accept

        protected final void accept(AbstractEvent<? extends T> event)
        Consumes the supplied AbstractEvent by forwarding it to the Consumer.accept(Object) method of each Consumer registered with this EventDistributor.
        Specified by:
        accept in class ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer<T extends HasMetadata>
        Parameters:
        event - the AbstractEvent to forward; may be null in which case no action is taken
        See Also:
        addConsumer(Consumer), ResourceTrackingEventQueueConsumer.accept(AbstractEvent)
